values.description:
In this PR I address [[CLOUD-75]](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-75).

A dropdown element was created to list Amazon Regions, in order to avoid duplicated code between the fields of the Simulator and Field Computer. It starts blank by default.

A warning is fired if the user wants to continue without completing all the fields from either Simulator or Field Computer. The GitHub repository and Team Name are already being checked. Should the Github Deploy Key be checked as well? So far it does not fires a warning.

ptal @chapulina
fyi @andres_fortier

Screenshots:

Normal view.
![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902447473.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/4160349592-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902447473.png)

Opening a dropdown.
![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902467462.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/2865584985-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902467462.png)

Warning on Simulator's empty fields.
![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902524141.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1348726070-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902524141.png)

Warning on Field Computer's empty fields.
![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902541044.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1220771827-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902541044.png)
values.title: Amazon Region Dropdown

values.description:
In this PR I address [[CLOUD-74]](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-74).

A new dropdown element that uses `paper-dropdown` was made in order to list and select Amazon EC2 Instance Types.

If any field of Simulator or Field Computer is empty when the user clicks the continue button, a warning is fired. This was also done in [Pull Request #157](#!/osrf/cloudsim-widgets/pull-requests/157/amazon-region-dropdown).

ptal @chapulina
fyi @andres_fortier

Screenshots:

Normal view.
![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493912186557.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1692171669-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493912186557.png)

values.description:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-85](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-85). A refresh button was included in the `cs-usermetrics` element. Upon clicking it, it calls the `gz-resources` method that makes the ajax request. The metrics are refreshed without the need to refresh the whole page.

ptal @chapulina
fyi @andres_fortier

Screenshot:
![screencapture-localhost-8080-profile-1494267503709.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/2686049324-screencapture-localhost-8080-profile-1494267503709.png)

values.description:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-73](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-73). The server status element makes an ajax request periodically to the given URL. If the response is satisfactory, a green check gives the positive feedback. If the URL can't be reached, the icon changes to a red 'X'.

The url on this element has it's own class, so it would be easier to style from parent elements. The request interval can be set when the element is created, using `<cs-serverstatus url=... refresh-interval=...></cs-serverstatus>`. The default is 30 seconds. Notice that this number needs to be in milliseconds.

A Server Status List element was created in order to maintain the profile element's logic and style. Better icon and header suggestions are always welcome.

fyi @andres_fortier

Screenshot:
![screencapture-localhost-8080-profile-1494444483892.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/210506741-screencapture-localhost-8080-profile-1494444483892.png)
values.title: Server Status Element

summary.raw:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-73](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-73). The server status element makes an ajax request periodically to the given URL. If the response is satisfactory, a green check gives the positive feedback. If the URL can't be reached, the icon changes to a red 'X'.

The url on this element has it's own class, so it would be easier to style from parent elements. The request interval can be set when the element is created, using `<cs-serverstatus url=... refresh-interval=...></cs-serverstatus>`. The default is 30 seconds. Notice that this number needs to be in milliseconds.

A Server Status List element was created in order to maintain the profile element's logic and style. Better icon and header suggestions are always welcome.

fyi @andres_fortier

Screenshot:
![screencapture-localhost-8080-profile-1494444483892.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/210506741-screencapture-localhost-8080-profile-1494444483892.png)
summary.html:
In this PR I address CLOUD-73. The server status element makes an ajax request periodically to the given URL. If the response is satisfactory, a green check gives the positive feedback. If the URL can't be reached, the icon changes to a red 'X'.

The url on this element has it's own class, so it would be easier to style from parent elements. The request interval can be set when the element is created, using <cs-serverstatus url=... refresh-interval=...></cs-serverstatus>. The default is 30 seconds. Notice that this number needs to be in milliseconds.

A Server Status List element was created in order to maintain the profile element's logic and style. Better icon and header suggestions are always welcome.

fyi @andres_fortier

values.description:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-72](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-72).

In the `cs-usermetrics` element, admins are now allowed to create identities and their instance hours budget, along with setting whitelisted and enabled parameters of the metrics config. Admins can edit the metric config as well, by clicking the items in the list.

Along creation or edit, Admins can grant read and write permission over the resource to a given identity. This is an input field, with the default input value being src-admins. A blank input means that no permission should to be granted.

In the screenshot, you can see that the config for the identity "Test" sets it's budget to 4 hours, exhausting it.

I had a problem with some responses from the API. I opened [CLOUD-101](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-101) to keep track of it. Perhaps it's not the API itself but the grants element. I couldn't have access to the grantee nor the resource with the grant callback's event details.

Several test metric configs were created. They should be deleted, but the API is not implemented. The issue for this is [CLOUD-98](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-98).

fyi @andres_fortier
ptal @chapulina

Screenshots:
![screencapture-localhost-8080-profile-1495037598415.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/198454939-screencapture-localhost-8080-profile-1495037598415.png)
![screencapture-localhost-8080-profile-1495037615466.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/632648429-screencapture-localhost-8080-profile-1495037615466.png)
values.title: Set and Update User Budget

In the cs-usermetrics element, admins are now allowed to create identities and their instance hours budget, along with setting whitelisted and enabled parameters of the metrics config. Admins can edit the metric config as well, by clicking the items in the list.

Along creation or edit, Admins can grant read and write permission over the resource to a given identity. This is an input field, with the default input value being src-admins. A blank input means that no permission should to be granted.

In the screenshot, you can see that the config for the identity "Test" sets it's budget to 4 hours, exhausting it.

Several test metric configs were created. They should be deleted, but the API is not implemented. The issue for this is CLOUD-98.

values.description:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-108: Create UI to display SRC tasks data](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-108). 

A new link in the left menu was added. This routes to `/src-results`, which displays data from each `srcsimulations` resource. Each one contains 5 rounds that contain 3 tasks, along with a Score and Total Time fields. These elements are collapsible.

The data of the task is displayed in a natural format, using a custom format behavior. A task is considered "Waiting" when no starting time has been provided.

Note that current resources only have one round and one task. They should be passed as an array. In the current implementation, they need to be converted to an array.

New elements:

* `cs-srcresults` contain the `srcsimulations` resources.
* Each round of the simulation is passed into a `cs-srcroundresult` element, that contain the information of that round. The fields will be implemented in [CLOUD-124](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-124).
* A `cs-srctasks` element manages each task.
* `cs-formatter-behavior` is an element that provides a [behavior](https://www.polymer-project.org/1.0/docs/devguide/behaviors) for displaying data in a natural way. This helps to avoid repeated code between elements that present data.

ptal  @andres_fortier 

Screenshots:

![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496322251830.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1798032423-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496322251830.png 'screencapture-localhost-8080-src-results-1496322251830.png')
values.title: Task Data UI

A new link in the left menu was added. This routes to /src-results, which displays data from each srcsimulations resource. Each one contains 5 rounds that contain 3 tasks, along with a Score and Total Time fields. These elements are collapsible.

The data of the task is displayed in a natural format, using a custom format behavior. A task is considered "Waiting" when no starting time has been provided.

Note that current resources only have one round and one task. They should be passed as an array. In the current implementation, they need to be converted to an array.

New elements:

  • cs-srcresults contain the srcsimulations resources.
  • Each round of the simulation is passed into a cs-srcroundresult element, that contain the information of that round. The fields will be implemented in CLOUD-124.
  • A cs-srctasks element manages each task.
  • cs-formatter-behavior is an element that provides a behavior for displaying data in a natural way. This helps to avoid repeated code between elements that present data.

values.description:
We need to replace these chars ":" and "." in the timestamp  to be able to use it as part of a path in -v option of `docker run`

After this our world names will have the form: `world_1_2017-06-02T18-26-11-203Z`
values.title: make the ISO timestamp be more "docker mount volumes (-v) friendly"

summary.raw:
We need to replace these chars ":" and "." in the timestamp  to be able to use it as part of a path in -v option of `docker run`

After this our world names will have the form: `world_1_2017-06-02T18-26-11-203Z`
summary.html:
We need to replace these chars ":" and "." in the timestamp to be able to use it as part of a path in -v option of docker run

After this our world names will have the form: world_1_2017-06-02T18-26-11-203Z

values.description:
* Admins must choose which worlds to enable when starting a new constellation

![enwo1.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/4049624270-enwo1.png)

* Worlds are stored in the round data in a `data.worlds` array

* For backwards compatibility, rounds containing no `worlds` array have all buttons enabled

* Rounds with an empty `worlds` array mean they were launched by competitors during practice, so we display all rounds

* For rounds started by admins, only the enabled worlds start buttons show up:

![enwo2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/494891713-enwo2.png)
![enwo3.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1695713366-enwo3.png)
![enwo4.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/2573929917-enwo4.png)
values.title: [SRC] Select worlds for constellations started by admins

values.description:
This PR will just enable / disable Run / Stop buttons based on the current state of the cloudsim-sim state_machine . 
Ie. if the machine is in READY state then any round button can be clicked. If state is 'running', then all run buttons are disabled and Stop button is enabled.  
Similarly happens with FC Start/Stop buttons.

Once we add simulation launch status related events (eg. pending, success, failed) , the logic to enable/disable these buttons will be updated as part of another PR
values.title: updated run/stop button disabled status based on srcsim state

Similarly happens with FC Start/Stop buttons.

summary.html:
This PR will just enable / disable Run / Stop buttons based on the current state of the cloudsim-sim state_machine . Ie. if the machine is in READY state then any round button can be clicked. If state is 'running', then all run buttons are disabled and Stop button is enabled.
Similarly happens with FC Start/Stop buttons.

values.description:
This is a work in progress PR. In it, I address [CLOUD-138](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-138) and partially [CLOUD-139](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-139), as the `simulator_ready` is yet to be merged.

Also, a new line in the status sub box should contain `harness_status`.

Related: [#!/osrf/cloudsim-sim/pull-requests/67/monitor-src-ihmc-controller-and-harness/diff](#!/osrf/cloudsim-sim/pull-requests/67/monitor-src-ihmc-controller-and-harness/diff)

I believe there is an issue in the SENDING LOGS state of the state machine:

From logging the change of the srcsimData value, I noticed that the state goes from Ready to Running when a round is clicked. After stopping, it is finishing, finished and then it goes back to ready, skipping the Sending Logs state. Could it be that, since the tests are quick, the logs is fast enough to not being caught by the console log?

fyi @andres_fortier , @iche033 , @preyna 

Screenshot

![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1496789072025.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1259108785-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1496789072025.png 'screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1496789072025.png')
values.title: Status display in Kiosk

This is a work in progress PR. In it, I address CLOUD-138 and partially CLOUD-139, as the simulator_ready is yet to be merged.

Also, a new line in the status sub box should contain harness_status.

Related: #!/osrf/cloudsim-sim/pull-requests/67/monitor-src-ihmc-controller-and-harness/diff

I believe there is an issue in the SENDING LOGS state of the state machine:

From logging the change of the srcsimData value, I noticed that the state goes from Ready to Running when a round is clicked. After stopping, it is finishing, finished and then it goes back to ready, skipping the Sending Logs state. Could it be that, since the tests are quick, the logs is fast enough to not being caught by the console log?

fyi @andres_fortier , @iche033 , @preyna

Screenshot

values.description:
Whenever a Constellation's field computer fails to build, an error notification is fired. If there are multiple constellations running, one cannot tell which one caused it.

In this PR I include the name of the constellation inside the error message.

Having an error in one constellation does not affect other running constellations. Their buttons disable correctly.

ptal @preyna 

Screenshot excerpt:

![failuremsg.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/234946276-failuremsg.png 'failuremsg.png')
values.title: Notify which Constellation failed to build FC

values.description:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-156](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-156). A copy button was included to each key in the `cs-s3keys` element.

Normally, when a row of the table is clicked, the corresponding keys dialog is shown. This is prevented from happening when the copy button is clicked.

A notification is shown whenever a key is copied.

ptal @preyna 

Screenshot:

![Voila_Capture 2017-06-09_1-24-4_pm.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1079546954-Voila_Capture%202017-06-09_1-24-4_pm.png 'Voila_Capture 2017-06-09_1-24-4_pm.png')

values.description:
Here I address the comment on [PR #191](#!/osrf/cloudsim-widgets/pull-requests/191/copy-s3-keys/diff).

The button and copy element were separated. This way, the button can call the copy method and also cancel the event propagation without affecting it.

As each row is dynamically created, the copy element IDs are parsed with the index and referenced in the button's on-tap method.

I hope this way is more clean. I tested it and it works well.

ptal @preyna
values.title: Cancel event bubble in Copy S3 Keys.

The button and copy element were separated. This way, the button can call the copy method and also cancel the event propagation without affecting it.

As each row is dynamically created, the copy element IDs are parsed with the index and referenced in the button's on-tap method.

I hope this way is more clean. I tested it and it works well.

ptal @preyna
summary.html:
Here I address the comment on PR #191.

The button and copy element were separated. This way, the button can call the copy method and also cancel the event propagation without affecting it.

As each row is dynamically created, the copy element IDs are parsed with the index and referenced in the button's on-tap method.

I hope this way is more clean. I tested it and it works well.

ptal @preyna

values.description:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-159](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-159). When one of the run buttons of the Simulator is clicked, there is a delay between the state change from `READY` to `RUNNING`. During this time, the buttons are enabled and can be clicked multiple times. This causes simulations to stack: The first one goes to `RUNNING` state while the rest are `WAITING`. For example:

* simulation-003 has `data.stat: "RUNNING"`
* simulation-004 to simulation-015 have `data.stat: "WAITING"`

Clicking Stop causes the current one to finish and then the following simulation that was `WAITING` starts to run. 

![before3.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/2961668395-before3.gif 'before3.gif')

\(Practice mode was taken off to show only Status and Run boxes side by side)

To prevent this, all the Run buttons are forced to be disabled whenever any of them is clicked. This stops once the simulation state machine changes, and they are activated normally according to this state.

![after.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3042135561-after.gif 'after.gif')

This also occurs on the Field Computer Run button, but since it is just one button, it is only disabled without needing a property. It is enabled normally.

ptal @andres_fortier
values.title: Disable buttons to avoid Multiple Clicks.

summary.raw:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-159](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-159). When one of the run buttons of the Simulator is clicked, there is a delay between the state change from `READY` to `RUNNING`. During this time, the buttons are enabled and can be clicked multiple times. This causes simulations to stack: The first one goes to `RUNNING` state while the rest are `WAITING`. For example:

* simulation-003 has `data.stat: "RUNNING"`
* simulation-004 to simulation-015 have `data.stat: "WAITING"`

Clicking Stop causes the current one to finish and then the following simulation that was `WAITING` starts to run. 

![before3.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/2961668395-before3.gif 'before3.gif')

\(Practice mode was taken off to show only Status and Run boxes side by side)

To prevent this, all the Run buttons are forced to be disabled whenever any of them is clicked. This stops once the simulation state machine changes, and they are activated normally according to this state.

![after.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/3042135561-after.gif 'after.gif')

This also occurs on the Field Computer Run button, but since it is just one button, it is only disabled without needing a property. It is enabled normally.

ptal @andres_fortier
summary.html:
In this PR I address CLOUD-159. When one of the run buttons of the Simulator is clicked, there is a delay between the state change from READY to RUNNING. During this time, the buttons are enabled and can be clicked multiple times. This causes simulations to stack: The first one goes to RUNNING state while the rest are WAITING. For example:

  • simulation-003 has data.stat: "RUNNING"
  • simulation-004 to simulation-015 have data.stat: "WAITING"

Clicking Stop causes the current one to finish and then the following simulation that was WAITING starts to run.

(Practice mode was taken off to show only Status and Run boxes side by side)

To prevent this, all the Run buttons are forced to be disabled whenever any of them is clicked. This stops once the simulation state machine changes, and they are activated normally according to this state.

This also occurs on the Field Computer Run button, but since it is just one button, it is only disabled without needing a property. It is enabled normally.

ptal @andres_fortier

values.title: Fix: valid harness in 0 being displayed as N/A
